triples.name: Dialogue system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses knowledge-grounded dialogue as the primary task requiring retrieval-augmented models.

triples.name: Question answering
triples.relevance: Open-domain QA inspired the retrieval-in-the-loop architectures that the paper adapts for dialogue.

triples.name: Chatbot
triples.relevance: The paper aims to improve state-of-the-art dialogue models and chatbots by reducing factual hallucination.

triples.name: Hallucination (artificial intelligence)
triples.relevance: Knowledge hallucination is the core problem that the paper targets and demonstrates substantial reduction of.

triples.name: Seq2seq
triples.relevance: The encoder-decoder architectures used in the paper are seq2seq models, which are fundamental to the approach.

triples.name: Attention (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Attention mechanisms are core components of modern encoder-decoder models used in the paper.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: Neural retrieval components require information retrieval techniques to fetch relevant documents for grounding dialogue.

triples.name: Neural machine translation
triples.relevance: Neural machine translation introduced seq2seq encoder-decoder architectures that the paper builds upon for dialogue.

triples.name: Retrieval-augmented generation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes neural-retrieval-in-the-loop architectures as an implementation of retrieval-augmented generation for dialogue.
